intro: Lotononis trisegmentata f. sericea, commonly known as the silky lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely hairy, silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a valuable addition to native plant collections.
